page.title: 08MUSEUM (CONT)
page.content: The buildings in which the museum is housed were erected in 1856 as the headquarters of the Loyal North Militia. They became the headquarters of Lincolnshire Yeomanry until it was separated in 1918. They were then used by the Territorial Army and others until acquired by the Lincs. Association in the 1960's. The site is known as the Old Barracks to differ it from the New or Sobroan Barracks built for the Royal Lincolnshire Regiment further north on Burton Road. The most remarkable feature of the gatehouse is the vaulted brick ceiling giving a honeycomb appearance. At the back of the museum is a row of cottages erected as part of the barracks, and opposite them is Ellis' Mill on Mill Road.
